heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 04 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.8°C) and outside temperature (down 5.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 13%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 1075 m) and light levels (up 9476 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 11632 lux) and cloud levels (up 1415 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 1074.6m lower than yesterday, 508.3m lower than the past week, 1415.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 835m minimum and 3910m maximum, with an average of 1110.7m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1619.0m and 2530m.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, occasional overcast conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.
